name: Wisteria
description: Wisteria is a genus of fast-growing, deciduous climbers. It contains about 10 species of woody climbing vines in the family Fabaceae, native to East Asia and the USA.They are ideal for training into trees, covering walls and other garden structures or as a freestanding half standard. Wisterias require high maintenance and usually begin flowering within three to five years of planting.
meaning: Thomas Nuttall, an English botanist, named this genus in honor of Dr. Caspar Wistar (1761 – 1818), who was an American physician and anatomist.
color_description: Wisteria comes in shades of white, blue, purple and pink.
